course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Chemistry in Everyday Life
course.description: This course is intended for students with very little to no chemistry background. The basic ideas and principles of chemistry will be explained through many examples of everyday life. The course will focus on developing a chemical understanding of the materials and processes that surround us in the world. Many relevant topics will be discussed such as the air, air pollution, global warming, ozone depletion, metals and their uses, minerals and gems, fire and fuels, color and light, food and drinks, household chemical products, polymers and drugs.
course.exclusions: Level 3 or above in HKDSE 1/2x Chemistry OR HKDSE 1x Chemistry, a passing grade in AL/AS Chemistry, CHEM 1010, CHEM 1020, CHEM 1030, any CHEM courses at or above 2000-level

reviews.author: Vincentchan9839
reviews.title: A torturing course to learn (too) many basic chemistry things in a very short time 😭
reviews.comment_content:
Like many other courses in HKUST, this course crams the 3-year chemistry HKDSE syllabus in only 3 months, which is entirely challenging to understand all of them (unless you are the elite one).

There are 6 chapters for this course:

Chapter 1: What is everything made of? (J)
Chapter 2: Air (E)
Chapter 3: The air and our environment (E)
Chapter 4: The metals in our daily life (E)
Chapter 5: Metals in the industry (J)
Chapter 6: Fire and fuels (J)

(J: taught by Professor CHAN, Kwan Kit Jason;
E: taught by Professor TSANG, Ming Wai Emily)

***(Usually in the previous semesters, only Professor CHAN would teach all chapters but he was really busy in this semester, so part of the chapters were taught by Professor TSANG)

Before starting each chapter, there are some recommended reading lists that you are optional to read them (but I never read any of them since I was too busy in other courses) to let you have some basic overview of the coming chapter you are going to learn.

At the end of each chapter, there will be an exercise worksheet for you to do (which is optional to do). But I still recommend you to do that if you want to get good result in the quizzes and the final exam.

In this course, you need to do a project (either an individual written study report, a group experimental study project or a group video clip study project).

There are two graded quizzes and a final exam.

You can see the attachments for more information.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Overall speaking, both professors are good to teach this course.

For Professor CHAN, Kwan Kit Jason, he is also called Dr Fire if you know he has shown up in a local TVB television programme called Sidewalk Scientist many times. His teaching is better than Professor Emily Tsang since he has taught CHEM1004 for 6 years if I remember it right. His teaching is interesting as he almost did at least one experiment in each lecture. He is more fluent in conducting the materials to us. I have asked him through emails and he answer all my questions clearly within a day.

For Professor TSANG, Ming Wai Emily, she is not as good as Dr Fire as her teaching was more slower in pace. She sometimes has difficulties in explaining the things to us. So, after the class, I have to read through the notes for multiple times before barely understand what she has said in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
I would say it is satisfactory.

I have heard from my classmates (and also checked  some reviews in UST.SPACE) that you will get B- to C+ if you get mean in overall.


Grading policy is shown below:

10 % from the two Online Graded Quizzes (which means 5 % for the first graded quiz and 5% for the second graded quiz)
35 % from the Study Project*
55 % from the Final Examination

The course is graded from A+ to F. An F grade will not earn you credits for the course.  

*Note that failure to complete the study project would result in an F grade.


Here are some statistics:

Quiz 1 (out of 45):
Mean: 34.5
Highest: 45
Lowest: 0

Quiz 2 (out of 50):
Mean: 39.8
Highest: 50
Lowest: 0

Project (out of 35):
Mean: 29.0
Highest: 35
Lowest: 0
SD: 3.5

Final Exam (out of 100):
Mean: 54.4
Highest: 92
Lowest: 0
SD: 18.2


My result:

Quiz 1: 33/45 (I have made too many mistakes in this quiz since I have not done any revision when doing this quiz)

Quiz 2: 50/50 (I ask sources for this quiz from my friends)

Project (I choose the individual one, use nearly three weeks to make a really long and detailed one): 33/35

Final Exam: 78/100


Grade: A


You can see that if you are hardworking enough, plus you are really good at science, you can pick up all the things very quick and get good grade at last.
reviews.comment_workload:
If you want to get good grade in this course, you will do many things to secure A range. (so you need to be hardworking, which can drive you crazy just like me)

I have finished all end of chapter exercises and had a quite hard time in trying to understand all the things as soon as possible.

Here is my background. I did not select chemistry in senior secondary school as the teaching style of the chemistry teacher in my secondary school was really terrible. I only had Form 3 chemistry background to study this course.

Also, I just did revision a few days before the final exam since the workload in this semester for me was quite heavy. I did not have time to revise this course throughout the week until the study break period.

Luckily, maybe I am good at science, I still managed to cram nearly all things in my brain and can memorize most of them in the final exam.

If you just want good grade with least effort, this would not be the one you should consider, take another course instead because CHEM1004 is a torture for me despite I get A grade in this course.

😵🙁

reviews.author: zack0617
reviews.comment_content:
內容大部分係中學CHEM程度，主要cover Air, metal 及fire 三個本質以及相關化學知識。全COURSE合共6個CHAPTER，教唔完會CUT走最後個CHAPTER既少部分。

LECTURE NOTE同POWER POINT有齊考試既重點，而且焦點清晰唔難明，唔同課題間亦有明顯既過渡，容易follow，係學到野既。如果中學冇讀過CHEM，或者DROP左CHEM既朋友，可以試下讀。

reviews.comment_grading:
2次CANVAS REVISION QUIZ: 合共10%
(每個QUIZ有一個禮拜時限)

Project: 30%
(INDIVIDUAL約一個月時限，GROUP就再多約一個月)
(GROUP個mean通常高啲，高2~3分)

Final: 60%
(closed book, 35MC, 3 SAMPLE CASE STUDIES) (MEAN: 52/100，SD約19分)

PROJECT踩MEAN，FINAL高~1.9SD，OVERALL: ~83%，GRADE: A (真係估唔到，應該剛好過cut off，原本以為得A-)
reviews.comment_workload:
可以話少。

兩個QUIZ 既SOURCE通街都係，個MEAN去到8成。

PROJECT 同FINAL前溫書差不多係成個COURSE所有既WORKLOAD。我就做INDIVIDUAL PROJECT，寫十頁紙去解釋事物背後的化學、科學，我大約用半日時間已經交得。

FINAL前睇NOTE，背少少化學野，睇下每個CHAPTER既EXERCISE就可以入試場，大約已經可以拎到六、七成分數，剩低既三、四成分就睇下勤唔勤力同謹唔謹慎。

reviews.author: YOqwqeeweqw
reviews.title: If you have past paper/chemistry background, you may easily get high score
reviews.comment_content:
都是教番DSE化學, 對讀過DSE化學(中途drop左或者無考DSE化學)的學生有利 不過我覺得冇化學底都可以追得上

相關課題:
Chapter 1: What is everything made of?
Chapter 2: Air
Chapter 3: The air and our environment
Chapter 4: The metals in our daily life
Chapter 5: Metals in the industry
Chapter 6: Fire and fuels

此外,要做project
可選個人或團體,但我個年因疫情關係,只有個人

要做兩個測驗,考番教過課題,有限時,不過成兩粒幾鐘,都夠時間做

This course is for students who do not learn chemistry so you will absorb basic chemistry knowledge which is not complicated.
If you study chemistry before and do not take the chemistry exam, you may think this course is easy.
But no worries, even if you do not have any chemistry background, I think you are still able to follow.

Relative topics:
Chapter 1: What is everything made of?
Chapter 2: Air
Chapter 3: The air and our environment
Chapter 4: The metals in our daily life
Chapter 5: Metals in the industry
Chapter 6: Fire and fuels

You need to finish a project(individual or group)
Due to the Covid-19, the project are all changed to individual

Also, you need to finish two quizzes with a time limit: around two hours so there is sufficient time for you to complete all questions
reviews.comment_teaching:
全程網課,火博士在堂上的筆記同Canvas 上載的不一樣, 不過之後會在Canvas上載堂上那一份,
他有時在堂上播有趣影片,肯回答學生問題

All lessons are online mode. The notes shown by Professor Jason are not same as you find in Canvas. but he will upload the notes he used in lesson on Canvas.
Sometimes he will play interesting videos during lesson and he is willing to answer any question from students.
reviews.comment_grading:
Project 分為三類(35%)
1.individual written study report(以化學角度研究日常你會用的東西,然後寫一篇報告)
2.individual experimental study project
3.individualvideo clip study project

測驗(10%)
*Quiz 1: Chap 1 to 4 (5%)
*Quiz 2: Chap 1 to 6 (5%)

考試(55%)
冇midterm
*大考(open book, 可以上網查資料)包括chap1 to 6

*令次考試和測驗都翻炒上年,只有數字不同,如果有上年試題,大機會拎九成分數

成績
1.Quiz 1: 37/50 (mean:39.6)
2.Quiz 2: 50/50 (mean:41.5)
3.Project : 26/35(mean:27.2)
4.Final : 96/100( mean:75.7)

Grade: B+

拎A-或以上有d難度,盡可能在project高過平均分及大考拎九成,才有機會拎A-或者以上


There are three types of individual projects(35%):
1,Individual study project( Write a chemistry report about the usual thing in your daily life)
2.individual experimental study project
3.individual video clip study project

Quizzes(10%)
1.*Quiz 1: Chap 1 to 4 (5%)
2.*Quiz 2: Chap 1 to 6 (5%)

Exam(55%)
No midterm exam
*Final(open book , you can search information online): Chap 1 to 6
*The questions in exam and quiz I take in spring sem are nearly same as the last fall semester, only the numbers changed. If you have past paper, you can easily get 9x% of total score)

Grade: B+

It is not easy to get A- or above. Your project score should be higher than mean while you get around 90% score in final exam, then you may get A.
reviews.comment_workload:
不算高
在project方面,如果想高過平均分, 要花啲時間去搜集資料
在考試方面,如果想拎九成,一定要讀熟筆記,即使你有歷屆試題,也不能確保一定翻抄

Not heavy
Regarding project, if you want to get score above mean, you really need to spend some time on research.
For exam, if you want to get 9x%, you need to be familiar with note contents. Even if you have past paper, it is not guaranteed that the questions are same as past papers.

reviews.author: NaturalEthan
reviews.title: Easy contents, but hard to get A+
reviews.comment_content:
The content covers the basic knowledge of chemistry, including organic chemistry, element chemistry and so on. The knowledge is very simple and this course emphasizes the chemistry in everyday life. However, the content is not suitable for most student, whom have learned chemistry during high school since it's too simple and useless for them.
This course has a project. You need to work individually or form a group to do a project about chemistry in daily life.
reviews.comment_teaching: Pro Kwan Kit Jason has an excellent teaching method! He teaches the knowledge by doing experiment and play interesting short videos. However, for me, the teaching has a drawback that the lecture notes seems to be piles of reading materials without a clear flow. If the lecture notes show more emphasis on basic concepts and formulas, the efficiency will be greatly enhanced.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading in this semester 19-20 Fall is a catastrophe and a failure. Due to the crisis happened in Hong Kong, the grade scheme changed from

Quizzs: 10%                                       Quiz 10%
Project 40%              to                   Project 50%
Final Exam 50%                              Final Exam(online)40%

The project grading is a disaster. The project has three means: individual, group(essay) and group(video). However, the means of them have a very great difference!
Individual(essay) 19.8/30
group(essay) 23.4/30
group(video) 25.0/30
And students don't know the grading standards and obviously the one choose group(video) tends to get a higher mark and eventually a greater grade, thus, it's unfair for those whom choose the first two means.

Also, some students break the academic integrity code when they took the final exam and the authoritativeness of the exam is damaged.
reviews.comment_workload:
Middle workload I think.
No homework, only two small quizzes.
However, you need to spend some time on the project. It's time-consuming for you to choose one appropriate topic and think about how to elaborate your essay or video.

reviews.author: wtsurfavbeyonce
reviews.comment_content: Teaches basic chemistry knowledge for those who don't have any chemistry background. Easy to understand and the pace is quite nice.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good teaching, lessons were not boring but not too interesting either.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading, my final score is higher than the mean for a few marks and I got a B.
reviews.comment_workload: Theres a group project with minimal guidance. We can choose from 10 suggested topics, but basically none of the topics were covered in the syllabus, or were taught near the very end of the course and we basically have to teach ourselves the whole concept and to do the experiment.

reviews.title: fair course
reviews.comment_content:
The course covers 6 chapters: Atoms, Air, Air pollution, Industrial metal, Metal in daily life and Fire and fuel. But due to the lack of time, we skipped chapter 6.

I think we've learnt almost all the important topics in DSE through this course, we got to learn how to write the chemical equation, how to draw the dot-cross diagram for different elements and compounds etc.

The content is very rich and I think there is a lot to study.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is super fun, as he filmed 學是學非in TVB, sometimes he would show his videos to explain some theories. There are lots of experiments in lectures too, and most of them are interesting for me. He would also invite students to assist him when performing the experiments. Lecture videos would be posted on canvas and no attendance so it's not a must to attend lectures.

However, sometimes he would be absent and just cancel the class after people already enter the lecture hall.

He tries to emerge the chemical theories into daily life so as to make it easier to understand. Exercises are also uploaded on canvas when he finished teaching a chapter. Do those exercise as they are similar to the final exam.
reviews.comment_grading:

Group project (30%): 26/30 (mean: 25.2)
Final exam (60%): 54/100 (mean: 54.2)

final grade: B-
As I didn't really study much for the final and I just study it at last minute so I think the grade is fair.
reviews.comment_workload: Only two online quizzes which you are allowed to finish it within a week, one project which you can choose to do it in a group or individually and a final exam. No midterm.

Most workload from project
meet once a week, around four times, searching information by yourself

reviews.author: fmbb
reviews.comment_content:
The course are similar to the DSE chemistry syllabus but more detailed. Students who dropped Chemistry in secondary school would have advantage studying the course as the syllabus are basically the same. But the course summarise all the things you have to learn in DSE into a semester, so actually it's quite chur.

There are 6 chapters in total.
Ch.1 Atoms
Ch.2 Air
Ch.3 Air and Environment
Ch.4 Metals
Ch.5 Metals in the industry
Ch.6 Fire and fuels
reviews.comment_teaching: Didn't attend most of the lesson, but lecture videos and exercise will be unloaded on Canvas. Only watch few of the videos as the it's quite boring when illustrating the concepts and the history. But it's quite good for him to provided a lecture for revision and uploaded some sample questions before the final exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
Revision Quizzes = 5%*2
Individual/Group Project = 30%
Final Exam = 60%

The grading is fair, as long as you have studied hard before the final. It's better for you to finish the end-of-chapter exercise as it might be similar to the online quizzes. But actually they are open book quizzes and all MCQ, so not that difficult if you have read the questions carefully.

The study project is very important as it contributes a lot to the grade and it's easy to get high marks. I think the score for both individual and group project are similar, and the only difference is that group project might have lighter workload(?)

For both quizzes and final exam, I was slightly above mean, and nearly got full marks in the individual project.
Final grade is B and I think it's reasonable as i didn't put much effort in revision for the final exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload.
Only two online quizzes (cover ch1-4 and ch4-6 respectively), one individual project(chemistry in everyday life)/group project (report of an experiment) throughout the semester, and 1 final exam. But better to start writing the report earlier as it's quite time consuming in amending the topic and doing research for the projects.

Overall, a good grade course with light workload, especially for those who have studied Chemistry in secondary school.

reviews.comment_grading: It is fair for me to get C+, since i am did not study chem before,

reviews.comment_grading: 期末考试巨难，因为是线上考试，原本很简单的test（往年测试卷）变得其难无比。原本线下考的难度大概就是问你“食用醋的酸是哪个酸啊？”，然后线上考难度变成让你给一个超难化合物命名并画出大致结构。离谱

reviews.author: ernestlweeeee

reviews.comment_content:
Introductory material to chemistry, requires minimal background knowledge, but do pay attention in class cuz stuff gets hard.

2: Air composition, Various types of bonds
3: Ozone and Air pollution

reviews.comment_teaching:
Absolute chad professor, poggers accent, much humor, calm demeanor.

Since I had zoom classes, he couldn't do experiments for us. Although he did show us videos of him doing experiments for tv shows.

Favorite class to go to.
reviews.comment_grading: Its a "You get what you deserve" course, cuz really the contents are introductory, so its up to you to pay attention and get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
This course has no assignments other than the project, but theres quizzes and a final exam so pay attention in class.

Quizzes are easy, just look at lecture notes and use some brain.

For the project, any reasonable topic will be fine, just show your enthusiasm and do some research. My topic was effectiveness of mouthwash, funny random topic, and still got a good grade.  

Final exam was reasonably challenging, if it was closed-book I would've failed lmao. Got around 74-77 out of 100 (dont remember exact grade)

reviews.comment_grading:
That's what 火燒後欄 mean.
I have strove to get good grades in this semester to ensure my scholarship which requires GPA above 3.7 won't be got killed. And finally finally, I got A+ in COMP 1021, MATH 1014, FINA 2203 (I got literally above 99% in these three courses). I thought the chemistry course won't be too awful. And then. When I saw my result and past cutoff, I knew I was going to be FUCKED UP.  I AM GOING TO GET A  B-. MY SCHOLARSHIP. MY BOSTON COLLEGE EXCHANGE. MY EVERYTHING. GONE WITH THE WIND!!!


Here is my result
Midterm 85/100 Mean: 75.7
Project 28/35 Mean: 27.1
Quiz 9.93/10 Mean: 8

overall it seems not too bad. However, I clearly know the mean of the course is C+. In this way, I somehow want to cry and scream. I paid a hard work this semester. But all my hard work has gone with the fucking grading!!!

Sorry I was wrong

Chemistry in everyday life, but the stuff you learn is far from everyday life :)

One thing I find quite nice is that the professor has made his own lecture notes, but I still took notes personally.

Chapters:
1. Atoms
2. Air
3. Air and Environment
4. Metals
5. Metals in the industry
6. Fire and fuels
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr Chan (aka Dr Fire) teaches decently, with many experiments to show the students to keep the lectures engaging. He also spends time answering questions after lectures which is nice.

In my opinion, the flow of the lectures is quite fast, and students with a weaker chemistry foundations might have to spend time revising after class.

reviews.comment_grading: It is a big class and the content is quite easy, so remember the  grading would become very harsh and your grade would be sososo fragile, like a few careless mistakes would cost you a sub-grade or grade.

reviews.author: Yifan
reviews.title: Good introductory chem course
reviews.comment_content:
I think the overall materials are not that hard, but there is a lot of material still.

There is a group project (video) that we had to do. (You could have chosen a solo report but that seems harder) The project itself was somewhat fun and frustrating at the same time especially when you are not familiar with a lot of your classmates at first. But if you can find the right team, this should be a pretty interesting experience
reviews.comment_teaching: The lectures are fun and engaging. Lots of experiments. Even if it is a big lecture, there is still plenty of opportunity to ask him questions.
reviews.comment_grading: It seems easy at first glance but to get a really good grade isn't all that easy. You still need to prepare for the exam really well and also work pretty hard on the project.
reviews.comment_workload: You do need to take some time to plan out and shoot the video. Because it is required that some experiments occurs, and booking materials, equipments and approval takes time, so it is best to plan out early. Lectures are fun so that part isn't bad. You still need to do quite some revision for the test if you are aiming for a good grade.

reviews.author: Ged
reviews.title: A Competitive course
reviews.comment_content:
Basic knowledge of Chem, I think most of them are covered in high school textbook. It is like a review of your high school chem.
If you wanna have a decent mark in project (no matter individual or group), extra knowledge is definitely needed coz you need to write an ESSAY!
reviews.comment_teaching: Jason is kind. He tried many ways to explain the knowledge, like playing some experiment videos or even doing experiment in front of camera (online teaching due to pneumonia), which is very helpful for online classes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz+project (or group project)+final exam=15+35+50
Almost everyone got full or nearly full marks in quizzes and the sd of project is relatively small so the grade largely depends on the final exam, which makes the final exam very competitive.
I got only several marks above mean in project (group project) and almost full in quiz and 1.2 sd above mean in final exam. It turned out to be A. Quite fair actually.
reviews.comment_workload:
DON'T CHOOSE TO DO GROUP PROJECT UNLESS YOU WANT TOO MUCH WORKLOAD!

Chemistry, I did IB so it's basically IB chemistry plus you need to memorise a little about fire extinguishers and some other rules and stuff but if you did IB chem it should be fine.

reviews.comment_teaching:

reviews.title: Great Course
reviews.comment_content:
If you have taken chemistry in high school, it will just be a review of old materials plus some new contents.
If you have not, then you might find it somewhat difficult, but it is not impossible to get a decent grade if you work hard for it.
reviews.comment_teaching: Wonderful and fun teaching, there are numerous experiments, so make sure you don't skip the lectures. Dr. Chan is keen on answering questions after class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Like I have mentioned in the content section, overall, this is not an extremely difficult course. However, it does take effort to master the contents covered. So if you put in 2-3 days a week to consolidate what you learn in class, you would not panic in the exam.

**Make sure you finish all the quizzes and know how to do them even after you have submitted.

**There were three options for project, including individual written report, group experiment, and creating a video showing understanding of chemistry. (the 2nd & 3rd options are completed in a group, more effort required, thus more time will be given, as opposed to written report. around 10 days )

I personally prefer the group experiment, fun and more time to complete.

** No attendance required for lectures.
reviews.comment_workload:
Honestly, not much work to do in the beginning, but make sure you finish all the homework Professor Chan assigns in class and review regularly if you don't want to have a panic attack in exam week. Consistent effort will reward you in the end.

- After-chapter homework (not mandatory but recommended)
- 2 online quizzes (graded, so make sure you review before you attempt)
- A choice of project from three options (1.individual written report. 2.Group experiment 3.Group creating a video)
- Final exam
- No midterm

I chose group experiment and I did not regret it.
It was tough communicating with everyone but worth it.
Not everyone was able to attend every single meeting, but we got it done in the end because we were all willing to contribute.

Word of advice: I had a pretty interesting combination of group mates from different background, and it worked out. So, give others a chance before you judge. Think of it as giving yourself a chance too.

**Don't be afraid to report to Professor Chan if you were assigned a free rider, Professor Chan is a nice guy.

Good luck.

reviews.author: Aaliyah
reviews.comment_content: Almost Senior High Chemistry, easy and fun to learn
reviews.comment_teaching: Good experiments, especially Halloween limited
reviews.comment_grading:
I joined a great group and won the first prize in class

In fact I didn't attend class so often, but I can catch up reviewing the lecture notes, finals are just reciting and a little understanding. Group project counts a lot so you have to work hard on the project. I got and A and my final is just a little above avg.
reviews.comment_workload:
No participation, only group project and final

Project includes experiment, report and poster

reviews.author: DrainGang
reviews.title: fantastic teaching but poor grade
reviews.comment_content:
Basic chemistry stuff, manageable if you pay some attention in class, but there will be people with some chemistry background taking the courses, so be ready to give some effort if you are new to chemistry.

Chp.1 Atoms
Chp.2 Air
Chp.3 Air and Environment
Chp.4 Metals
Chp.5 Metals in the industry
Chp.6 Fire and fuels (Organic Chem)

Contents are delivered with well-organized notes.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is fantastic, Jason is a very good lecturer that keeps his lessons interesting with clips from his appearances on TV shows, live experiments, and interesting powerpoints. His English is very good and there's no problem in understanding. Overall the lecture experience is very enjoyable.

Even if you don't attend the courses, videos of the lectures and powerpoints used in the lectures are all available online.
reviews.comment_grading:
Poor grading unfortunately, despite being such a great learning experience.

Revision quiz (10%): manageable, answer carefully and refer to your notes for satisfactory results.
My scores: Graded quiz one (44.5/46) mean: 39.6, Graded quiz two (27/35) mean: 29.6 Personally I find the second quiz more difficult.

project (50%): This is my main issue with the course, you have the choice between a written, solo project or a group project conducting experiments OR creating a video explaining some chemistry concepts. DO NOT do the solo project, repeat, DO NOT take the solo project. The mean scores from the solo projects are CONSISTENTLY lower than the group projects by about 10%, which made a HUGE difference in the final grades. I fell victim to this... My score: (22.5/30) mean: 22.5

final 40%

Online finals, the questions are VERY challenging with some questions somehow feeling out of syllabus, (This could be the result of the last 2 chapters being taught in quite the rush, parts like electrolysis and polymerization were not taught quite in depth.) My score: 66.1/100, mean (72.9)

The average for the course was very high, at around 75%, grading is poor as the mean grade was a C+, being a bit below mean, I got a C+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Manageable. Some concepts in the course takes a bit of effort to understanding if you are not used to chemistry in general.

The quizzes does not take much effort to prepare for, the project takes about a week to finish and I recommend studying for a few days before the finals to ensure a better result (than what I got...)

reviews.comment_grading:
revision quiz 10%
project 50%
final 40%
Usually the final would take heavier weighing, but was adjusted due to the circumstances this semester.
Make sure that you have good teammates for the group project. Or you can choose an individual project. Projects better go deep to get higher grades.
Overall the grading is fair.
Mean letter grade was C.
reviews.comment_workload:
It depends on your previous knowledge of chemistry really. I am a non-local and have taken simple chemistry lessons in high school so I feel that it's quite well-designed for students who have a basic understanding of chemistry.
But if you literally have no background knowlege of chemistry you are going to need to work harder and spend more time going over the materials.
The final exam was changed to open-book so we didn't have to do much review, just getting the materials ready.

reviews.author: Dgehsjdhf
reviews.comment_content:
DIverse and rich. Modules cover all chemistry basics. As a student who studied IB Chem SL, the content in this course was even richer than what I had learned.

Lecture videos provided. Detailed units please see others' comment.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Fire is a good teacher, and he did incorporate a lot of daily examples and experiment demonstrations. The pre-lesson preparation must be tedious and I really appreciated his efforts. Nevertheless, lecture videos and class notes are both provided. It's not necessary to join the physical class.
reviews.comment_grading: Due to the open book exam under the special arrangement, the average was quite high. People were quite strong academically and I suspect that a lot of students actually had a chemistry background. Project-wise, statistically videos and group projects have better grading as the prof. might prefer more creative ideas. I did individual projects with some organic chemistry elements, luckily the grade was quite pleasant.
reviews.comment_workload: Fair. Just project and final. The project can be in an individual format, while no presentation is needed. It's titled on any daily chemistry that interested you. Online quiz.

60% Final exam (A bit hard to get high mark but if you studied at least you will not score a low mark.)

reviews.author: wilbert caine
reviews.title: rich content
reviews.comment_content:
The course is divided into six Chapters:
Chapter 1: What is everything made of?
Chapter 2: The Air.
Chapter 3: The air and our environment.
Chapter 4: The metals in our daily life.
Chapter 5: Metals in the industry.
Chapter 6: Fire and fuels.

Overall, the course is appropriate to take as common core. Anyone could hardly get bored during the lecture because the lecture is full of demonstration and professor has a good sense of humour too.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor teaches very well. Dr. Fire always presents many onstage experiments for us. Prior to Halloween, he will use the time to do special experiments and distribute free candies for the class. End of chapter problems, lecture notes, slides, lecture videos, and other interesting videos will be uploaded to canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
The final grade for the course will be consisted of:
- 10 % from the Online Quizzes
- 30 % from the Study Project
- 60 % from the Final Examination

The course is graded from A+ to F.

There will be two types of study projects, and you are free to choose one or the other.
-Individual written study report
-Group Experimental study project
In view of the time needed for this project, there will be no mid-term examination for this course.
reviews.comment_workload: Since there is no mid-term for this course, the workload is considered very light. Although you need to complete two online quizzes on canvas, they merely take two hours each and little to no preparation. You are given options regarding the study project, so do not worry if you know none of your classmates. If you prefer group project, you could be assigned randomly to a group if you choose to do so. Suggested topics and sample report are also provided.

reviews.comment_content:
DSE level
If you have studied in Chemistry during your DSE levels (maybe you have dropped), anyway, do take this course! Contents being discussed are quite easy to be honest, even if you have never studied in Chemistry before, it should be easy to handle and understand.

Chapter 1:What is everything made of?
Chapter 2:The Air.
Chapter 3: The air and our environment.
Chapter 4: The metals inour daily life.
Chapter 5:Metals in the industry.
Chapter 6:Fire and fuels.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Jason is funny and the lectures are interesting, he sometimes plays some videos and performs some experiments during lectures.

One TA will be assigned to each study project group, and they are usually quite helpful in terms of helping the students to finish the experiment and report.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading.

Online quizzes: 10% (5% x 2)
Study project: 30%
Final exam: 60%

For the online quizzes, answers or the way to answer the questions can be easily found on google.

Easy to get a fair grade for the project, normally 20-25 over 30%, as long as you have not made any huge mistake with the project. (No presentation required)

Final exam is sharing quite a huge part of the grade of the course, not to difficult, spend time and some effort on the materials and final revising tutorials for a couple hours would be enough to deal with it.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is quite light to be honest, 2 online quizzes, 1 study project and 1 final exam.

There will be two online gradedquizzesin addition to the end-of-chapter exercises, the first quiz is after Chapter 4 (covering chapters 1 –4), and the second quiz is at the end of the course (covering mainly Chapters  4-6).  

One study project to be handed in by the end of the semester, require 10 pages in total.

reviews.author: Nixon
reviews.title: nice course
reviews.comment_content: DSE level. Not really hard to be understood but it includes a wide range of content. Revision is needed and better do preparation before all the lectures in order to understand if you are rookie of Chemistry. I only have F.3 level of knowledge before this course. So really need time on revision.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is passionate and he tries his best to explain all the content and give help to you during the project. Interesting teaching with a lot of experiment.
reviews.comment_grading: Everything around mean  (+- 0.5sd) and get  B
reviews.comment_workload: 2 online tests, no midterms, 1 group project, 1 final

reviews.author: Nicole MA
reviews.comment_content:
The teaching materials are interesting as well as related to everyday life. There are some exciting experiments carried out in lectures, and sometimes he plays interesting TV shows to teach and entertain at the same time.
Chapter 1:What is everything made of?
Chapter 2:The Air.
Chapter 3: The air and our environment.
Chapter 4: The metals inour daily life.
Chapter 5:Metals in the industry.
Chapter 6:Fire and fuels.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching is great.
He's always helpful and the lectures are not very boring. If you skip the lectures, you might miss a wonderful experiment. He gives the projects proper attention and help so that the project can be done without much difficulty.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair, but not as good as I expected.
Revision Quizzes 10%
Study Project 30%
Final Exam 60%
The quizzes are online, so you can do it together to avoid mistakes.
I got total of 89, both for my project and final, which is above mean about 1 SD, and I got A.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload mainly depends on whether you want to get a very good grade and the pains you are taking. For the group project, you have to have an interesting topic or a nicely written paper to get a high score. For the final, there is a lot to memorize so the preparation before the exam can be tough. So normally the workload is fine.

BE CAREFUL
ALL DSE CHEM STUFF

reviews.comment_grading:
very fair! I got B- and I am so happy, I guess that is the mean of the course
I teamed up with people that studied chem before for the group project and got 23/30 (the mean is 23.5 or something)
for the graded quizzes (10%), ask for sources

for the final exam, I was below mean for half sd though I studied very hard for it (like 5 days straight, with 5 hours of sleep and no sleep the day before the exam, still couldn't finish revising the whole syllabus), so BE CAREFUL IF YOU DIDNT STUDY CHEM BEFORE

YET, some of my friends that studied them before got C+ and D+ because they didn't revise for the final exam. so if you work hard for the course, you can probably get B- like me (I found 3 people to carry me btw, so you should find at least 1 to carry you if you know nothing about chem)

The final exam really matters. It is ok if the quizzes and the project is failed. However, you can earn all the grades back by the final exam.

reviews.author: ReBoom
reviews.title: Basic Chemistry
reviews.comment_content:
It is the most basic chemistry. If you have learned chemistry in high school, this course would be very easy to you. As for those who haven't studied chemistry before, you may need to pay more effort.
Chapter 1 What is everything made of
Chapter 2 Air
Chapter 3 The air and our environment
Chapter 4 The metals in our everyday life
Chapter 5  Metals in the industry
Chapter 6  Fire and fuels
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is friendly. In the class, he would perform some interesting chemistry experiment.
reviews.comment_grading:
2*Online quiz(10%,each 5%)
It is an open-book online quiz. You can do this quiz with your friend if you want to get higher grades.

project(30%)
You can choose between group project or individual project.  Nearly 2/3 people in the class choose to do the group project. In terms of group project, you need to carry out an experiment and write the report. As for individual project, you can choose anything in your everyday life and write its chemical principal and making process or something related in the report.

final(60%)
final is easy if you do study. There would me MC and short questions.

For me:
First online quiz 50/50 (mean 41)
Second online quiz 49/50 (mean 41.8)
Individual project 30/30 (mean 20.8, some people say people doing the individual project always get lower scores than those doing group project. However, this semester, the professor gave one 30, one 29.5, three 29 to students doing individual project and the highest score he gave to the group project was 29)
Final 92/100 (mean 52.7, sd 21.1)
Overall 95.1%
Get A+
reviews.comment_workload: If you want to get a high score in project, you definitely need to spend some time. And you need to memorise some content if you hanker ace the final. Please remember to read his lecture note because you can almost find every final's answer in the lecture note.

reviews.author: Chacha
reviews.comment_content:
This course mainly focuses on the basic concepts of chemistry. Many of them are covered in DSE syllabus, so it's relatively easy for those dropped chem in secondary school.

The following chapters are included:
Chapter 1:What is everything made of?
Chapter 2:The Air.
Chapter 3: The air and our environment.
Chapter 4: The metals in our daily life.
Chapter 5:Metals in the industry.
Chapter 6:Fire and fuels.
Chapter 7*:Food, Drinksand medicine
(*Will be taught if schedule is allowed)
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Chan is a local instructor and he can carry out the lectures in fluent English. He loves to demonstrate experiments during classes, especially in some occasions like halloween. Those interesting demonstration can explain the chemical mechanism in a simpler way, that even the students with no chemistry background can still understand well.
reviews.comment_grading:
The final grade for the course will be consisted of:
10 %from the Online Quizzes
30 %from the Study Project
60 %from the Final Examination

I have got over 60% in the final exam, which is ~0.5SD above mean. And with a total of ~70% of the course completion, receiving a B+ at the end, which I think is fairly good.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload: 2 online quizzes, 1 project(either individual or in group) and 1 final exam.

For the project, I prefer working as a group because it is quite difficult to get a high score in individual projects. (Some outstanding students will submit their own project with over 30 pages, which I think is a bit too much for a common core course.)

For the revision, I think it may not be enough if you just read all the notes provided (in particular for those with no chem background). Better to do more exercises and prepare well for the exam.

reviews.author: nming
reviews.title: 好有心教嘅professor
reviews.comment_content: 我自己dse冇讀過chem所以讀左呢個course 佢會由好basic嘅野開始 一開始會講下啲歷史或者有代表性嘅實驗咁 然後就會逐步講下啲讀chem最基本要識嘅野 例如計下mole同埋啲做實驗會用得到嘅基本formula同埋會教下balance chemical equation 第二課就會講下octet rule,教你唔同嘅bonding,唔同嘅intermolecular force,仲有教你畫下啲bonding咁 第三課之後開始會難啲 佢會用好多日常生活嘅例子黎講chem 啲lecture notes會跳得幾快下 有時我自己都跟唔到要上網睇人地解釋翻 後面嗰幾課我建議盡量上齊堂 佢一堂都講得幾多野下 一miss左會好難跟得翻
reviews.comment_teaching: 佢好有心教我地 成日會帶啲野黎lecture做實驗俾我地睇 啲實驗好有趣 有時會邀請下同學落去挽下 同埋佢會成日播下片俾我地睇啲有趣嘅chem實驗 感覺到佢好有心教啲學生

Study project可以揀一個人或都同其他人一組做 我自己系一個人做嘅 佢要你揾一樣日常生活嘅物品黎做一個project 解釋下佢背後嘅化學理論
Exam係mc加幾題Long Question係幾題嘅case study 會用啲日常見到嘅野黎出題 呢科係拉curve嘅
我自己:
Quiz 1 32/50 (64%)
Quiz 2 30/50 (60%) 兩個quiz都低過mean
Study project 27.5/30 (92%) 接近max
Final Exam 50/100 (50%) 踩mean
最後B左 其實幾好grade

reviews.author: ming1993
reviews.comment_content:
From the very early times, people always desired to understand what the world is made up of, what is the nature of the materials that make up the world and the universe, why the materials behave the way they do.

We interact with many different materials every day: some are liquid while some are solid or gases; some of them are colourful while some are colourless; some may give out light; some may burn and give a flame; some are soft, some are hard; then some are living things, including ourselves, and some materials although are lifeless, but seems to have a mind of its own such as computers. There are so many natural and man-made phenomenon and situations that we encounter everyday which drive our curiosity, and in Chemistry we focus our understanding on the nature of matter and how and why matter behave the way that do.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is an amazing professor, very engaging. The lab sessions is however not taught by him - not that engaging or interesting. It's very hard to follow through labs.
reviews.comment_grading: Very confused about how it is graded - very subjected because you're graded regarding "creativity". The amount of time spent has no co relations with the end result.

There is really nothing so much to do for this course. The concepts are not so hard but you need to understand complex numbers clearly if you want to score good marks in final.

reviews.author: nar
reviews.comment_content:
The content was quite broad:

Chapter 1: What is everything made of? (Matters, atoms and their structure, arrangement, and their discoveries, elements, atoms counting)
Chapter 2: The air. (Covalent bonding, molecules and compounds, intermolecular forces, electronegativity and bond polarity, strength of bonds)
Chapter 3: The air and our environment. (Explanation on the process of global warming and ozone layer depletion, acid and bases)
Chapter 4: The metals in our daily life. (Properties of metals, metallic bond, alloys, ionic bonding, reaction of metals with oxygen, water, and acids)
Chapter 5: Metals in the industry. (Redox reactions, metal displacement reactions and their related topics: principles of metal extractions, electroplating, and batteries)
Chapter 6: Fire and fuels. (Fire, fire distinguishers, fuels, alkane, fireworks, explosives)
reviews.comment_teaching: The lectures moved quickly, but with interesting demonstrations. (in this semester a Halloween Trick or Treat demonstration was given!)
reviews.comment_grading:
- Project: absolute grading, an ordinary project deserved 21-22 marks over 30 marks
- Graded Quizzes: You should at least get 40/50
- Final Exam: Mean 51.9, SD 19.9.  Highest 99.
- My Overall Result: 71.5% -> B+
reviews.comment_workload:
- 1 Project - either Individual (30%) (introducing the chemistry behind something you find interesting in daily life) or Group Experimental Project (selected from provided topics or your make your own topic, a TA would be assigned to help you with your project, but my group didn't ask for any help from the TA)
- 2 Timed Graded Quizzes on Canvas (10%, the 1st one covered chapters 1 to 4, the 2nd one covered chapters 4 to 6)
- No Mid-term Exam
- Final Exam (60%, better to recite all the notes)

reviews.author: Ar Mong
reviews.comment_content: If you are not familiar with chemistry in HKDSE, this course will be hard to follow. It basically teaches the three year HKDSE chemistry in one semester. The first two chapters are easy to follow. But starting from chapter three(totally six chapters will be taught in one semester), if you don't have a solid base in chemistry, it will become extremely difficult. I still find it hard to follow even I study two years of chemistry in secondary school(I dropped it in the third year).
reviews.comment_teaching: Jason is fun and willing to reply to students. There are also some experiments in the lecture which are eye-catching. He makes the lessons have more fun than I expected.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are two online quizzes throughout the semester. You can refer to your notes or search in the internet for the answers. You can easily get a good grade of this part.
The other part is the group project/individual report. The marking is good and no need to worry as long as you put some work to it. It is usually set a topic and preform an experiment to prove it or compare the result. He will provide you some material you need for the experiment, he will also assign one of his PHD students to guide your group and give suggestions. But for individual report you won't get this kind of supports. You need to complete the whole report on your own.
The final is very difficult, it consist some parts that are not covered in the lecture. But the mean is low too, so the grade is not that bad.
reviews.comment_workload:
Like mentioned in the grading, there are not much workload. The group project please group with someone who won't freeride you. Otherwise you can't do it on your own. The grading for group project is slightly higher than individual report. But the workload is not so different.
He will provide some exercises about the notes, but they do not count towards your grade(BUT they do help you to understand the material and notes). You can make your own choice.

reviews.comment_teaching: Jason is really an interesting guy. He teaches with great patience and he will patiently answer your questions after class. There will always be some surprise in his class, for he sometimes bring you fascinating chemistry experiments.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading of this course concerns two online quizes, a big group project about every day chemistry and, above all, the final exam. The grading is fair but you have to work hard, especially in the final exam which accounts for quite a lot. There will be a lot for you to cover when you review, so it's a little bit annoying.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not that big, since we have already know most of the course in high school. Yet, you have to be familiar with the materials.

reviews.comment_teaching: Lots of experiments during lectures, even a set of Halloween-themed experiments on the last lecture before 31st Oct. Clearly Dr Chan was well-prepared, always tried to grab our attention. And replied emails very quickly. Lecture notes were very clear and concise,
reviews.comment_grading:
Almost guaranteed an A when the overall score is higher than the mean with 1 s.d.

60% final exam
reviews.comment_workload: The 2 quizzes were quite easy and the questions were pretty straightforward, pretty much followed the examples on lecture notes. It's said, by Dr Chan, that individual reports usually score lower than group reports by 1-2 points out of 30. I chose individual and it took me around 20 full hours to finish the whole thing and scored 26.5. The mean of individual was around 21 and that of group was around 22. The final exam consisted of 32 MCs and 3 SQs. Was very similar to the quizzes, low difficulty level as long as revision is enough. Questions include 'What does gold dissolve in?', the answer is aqua regia, HCl and HNO3. Very straightforward and didn't require much processing while answering.

reviews.author: helpme
reviews.title: A chemistry course with very interesting approach
reviews.comment_content:
Well, I would have to say that the content was partially new to me. True, some contents did overlap with those that I learned as a high school student, but the contents got more and more challenging as we finished up chapter 1,2,3 and 4.

Don't worry, it is definitely not difficult to understand the chemistry concept handled by this course, thats for sure if you make a certain degree of effort. However, what you should worry is that the approach of this chemistry course is hugely different with probably most of the chemistry courses - it is really about chemistry 'in everyday life'.  More than understanding the concepts, you should have a tight grip on the everyday usage of certain reactions, chemicals and manufacturing process if you want to do well in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: I whined about the contents, but this professor is just absolutely fantastic. He performs a lot of interesting experiments, dragging us closer to the course. He is also very willing to answer individual questions after each lecture, and he does so in a very cordial manner.
reviews.comment_grading:
Online quizzes... they are quite challenging (its a open notes quiz overall, so this is quite normal) - you will mostly have time issues when you work on the online quizzes. Also, you can't go back to the previous question after pressing next.

The final exam covers a lot of contents that was covered in the lectures. It would be a piece of cake if you are completely familiar with all the contents covered in lectures and notes. Well, the mean grade of this test shows that a heavy majorly of students, including me, are not. The professor once stated that memorization is not important in this class, but I think that was a joke.

Online Quiz 1: Mean = 36.4/50, SD = ?
Online Quiz 2: Mean = 38.7/50, SD = ?
Group/Individual Study Project: Mean = 22.7/30, SD = ?
Final Exam: Mean = 50.8/100, SD = 19.9


My Final Grade: A- (79.9%)
reviews.comment_workload:
I am not sure of what the others think about the workload of this course, but I think that it was one of the most time-consuming course that I had to take this semester (it worth it though).
You will feel like you are in heaven when you study earlier chapters, which would deal with basic chemistry that I think is either equivalent or lower than high school level.
However, when you make it to the second half, you might start to regret taking this course. Again, as a previously mentioned, concepts are not that challenging (at least to me). However, their are damn shit ton of things that you need to memorize. Lets say, instead of just understanding the 'metal replacement reaction', you should thoroughly memorize the refining process of iron ores, aluminum ores...etc. (don't think that the test will give you the chemical formula of those ores, its all about memorization...)

For the project, I think hard work definitely pays off.  What I heard is that professor tends to give higher grade to group projects than individual projects (in average), but I think that it does not matter if you make enough effort - the fact that you work on individual project won't drag you down as far as you make sufficient effort.

reviews.author: Sheryl
reviews.title: 冇Chem底既人要小心
reviews.comment_content:
It is a fundamental course for students who did not study any chemistry course in high school. However, many students who had previously study in chemistry but dropped out before HKDSE would also enrol in this course, which might increase the mean score. The content is basically high school content up to electrical chemistry and some organic chemistry. Students who are not previously studying in chemistry before would find these quite difficult to understand since the pace of the class is quite fast.

The handouts is comprehensive and design just like a secondary school textbook. Lecture slides with notes would upload to Canvas and students who do not go to class can also get answers.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Chan is humorus and easy-going. He would demonstrate experiment on lecture hall which effectively arouse students interests. Interesting videos like '學是學非' starring him would also showed. This give students an easier approach on chemistry.
reviews.comment_grading: I think his grading is normal. Students who always get mean during project and final whould get a C+ overall.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload of this course compare with other common core is quite low. No attendance. No prs. No mid terms.

Dr. Chan would give instructions early for projects so everyone can have enough time to finish it. The topic would be chemistry in everyday life's object and students can choose to do it individually or in a group. Final is little bit harder but some of the questions were mentioned in the practice worksheet.

reviews.author: Tuna
reviews.comment_content:
It is some basic Chemistry stuff.
In the later part of the course, some topics are quite hard which touch on some organic chemistry.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The prof is quite nice and he opens to questions. He explained the concept quite well.

I only attend two classes though. As it was a 9 am lecture and he provided lecture video which he will upload by the next day, so you can just simply skip the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair.
Assignment: average 98/100
Quiz: 100/100
Midterm: above mean 0.5 sd
Final: below a lot which is in around bottom 10% of the class size.
final grade: B-
reviews.comment_workload: There are six assignments in total but only the top 3 will be counted. So if you get full marks for the first three, you need not to submit the else.

reviews.author: Yen Soon
reviews.title: Good grade
reviews.comment_content: Rich content. Ensure that you read up on the provided materials and understand the underlying concepts.
reviews.comment_teaching: Interesting as experiements were shown during lecture. He goes through the lecture materials in class based on the notes provided. He also looks into students queries when in doubt. Make sure you do enough eg. Homework given in notes, that would help you prepare for class.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grade. I managed an A+ as a business student.
reviews.comment_workload: The project tests students on the application of chemistry and the composition of materials. Sufficient research would help you score well in the project.

- orbital

Redox reaction. Not difficult to learn at all even if you are a newbie in chemistry. [for student with no chemistry background only]
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Huang's lectures were clear enough in elaborating concepts in the syllabus. The only thing to complain is his accent. He had a heavy Chinese accent which might be difficult for some students to understand.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not bad at all, if you don not aim really high. In total of 348 students, he gave:
A: 86   24.7%
B 177   50.9%
C: 71   20.4%
D: 10   2.9%
F: 4      1.1%
Both my midterm and final above the mean by ~0.9 SD and overall is 91 point something, I got an A-. If you really want to get an A or A+, you must be careful enough in assignments and exams.
reviews.comment_workload: Light enough. There are five assignments in the entire term and only the three highest will count towards your grade. Some answers of assignments can be found in lecture notes. But beware it is not always easy to score a full mark.

reviews.author: hipster
reviews.title: A mixture of simple chemistry and complex concepts
reviews.comment_content:
The content is doable. Coming from IB, I didnt do chemistry and i realised there are some contents related to IB and IGCSE. There are IB Chemistry HL topics as well so dont think this is the easily chemistry so it must be easy. As a person from basic chemsitry background the content is not hard as long as you understand the concepts and math. mole calcualtions are not hard ifyou do 3-4 quesetions and understand how they work.
The battery topic is a little hard so make sure you understand how those calculation work with redox reactions because they will be in the exam.
reviews.comment_teaching:
due to the weather, some classes were cancelled and the last lesson was fully just read through but not taught.
Most lectures are just reading through the lecture notes so you can basically read it through yourself but you must be self disciplined to do so.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is okay.

31.5 / 35 Group Project
Final Grade: A-

reviews.author: King527
reviews.title: An OK introductory course to chemistry
reviews.comment_content:
I did not study chemistry in HKDSE but I heard that the contents are similar. So if you studied HKDSE chemistry before this course would be easy for you. There are a total of 6 chapters in the course. Each with a large number of contents that require recitation. Therefore, I would suggest those who enroll in this course revise every day otherwise there is no way for you to recite everything at the last minute.

From an academic perspective, the course provides some basic knowledge of chemistry, which is kind of useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: The two instructors carry some real-time experiments during lessons, which adds a lot of fun to the lecture. However, both of them teach very quickly. So if you miss one lecture or go for a toilet break, you will be confused very easily. Notes are provided and everything in the quizzes and final exam will be covered in the notes.
reviews.comment_grading:
The overall grading of this course is not good, but not bad as well. It mainly depends on how you do the project.

Quizzes: 10% ( has 2 quizzes, open book, done online)
Project: 35% ( You can choose group experimental project, group video project, or individual project)
Final exam: 55% (close book, done in sports hall)

My grade:
Quiz 1: 36/45 (Mean:34.5)
Quiz 2: 49/50 (Mean:39.8)
Project ( Group video project): 31/35 (Mean:30.7)
Final: 69/100 (Mean:53.8)
Overall grade: A-

Note: The most important thing here is to find good teammates that can carry you in the group project so that even if you perform poorly in the final exam you won't be sad after they release the grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of this course is very light. If you can understand the notes by yourself, you don't even need to join the lessons. There are no midterms or homework. If you choose the group project, the workload can be shared among teammates, which can reduce your workload as well.

reviews.author: eltonmiao
reviews.title: Good grade with appropriate effort
reviews.comment_content:
The course is divided into six Chapters:
Chapter 1: What is everything made of?
History of atom and simple calculations such as molar mass, number of atoms etc. (Very easy)
Chapter 2: The Air. (Easy)
Electron distribution, covalent bond, molecular compound, intermolecular force, electronegativity
Chapter 3: The air and our environment.
Acid and base, reactions reacted to air pollution and global warming, ozone and sunscreen. (Fine)
Chapter 4: The metals in our daily life.
Metallic bond, alloys, ionic bond, salts, reactions related with oxygen, water and acid. (Memorisation is needed)
Chapter 5: Metals in the industry.
All about redox reaction. Including the working principal of rechargeable battery. (This chapter should be the hardest to grasp)
Chapter 6: Fire and fuels.

Overall, the content is appropriate for those without any chemistry background. However, keep in mind that in this semester, only chapter 1-6 were taught.
Lecture video, PowerPoint, lecture notes provided. There is homework for each chapter but not graded.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr Jason Chan didn’t attend few lecture throughout the whole semester WITHOUT noticing us in advance. Therefore, chapter 6 was not taught and not examined.However, his teaching is good and there is in depth explanation of each homework. He uploads the homework tutorial lecture to YouTube. All lecture videos are also provided and released at the END of each chapter.
reviews.comment_grading:
10 % from the Online Quizzes
30 % from the Study Project
60 % from the Final Examination

Online Quiz 1: 37.5/46 Mean: 38.2 Max: 46
Online Quiz 2: 35/35  Mean: 28.7 Max: 35
Individual Project: 29.5/30  Mean: 21.9 Max: 29.5 ( I chose individual project instead of group project as I feel that you actually spend less time by doing the whole thing by your own and it truly reflects ur effort. Prepare at least 2 whole days for the individual project to get above mean results)
Final Exam: 75/100 Mean: 54.2 s.d. ~ 18.5 Max 89.5

Personally I don’t have any chemistry background except chemistry lessons in F.3. I am not those people who dropped chemistry in their secondary school.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is appropriate. Before the final exam, he arranged a final tutorial lesson to remind us some of the important points (what need to be memorised). He also uploaded the recording online. Overall appropriate workload except before the deadline of project and right before final exam. To help yourself understand better, it is a good idea to search for tutorials using YouTube. Remember to go through the lecture notes for at least two times. Attending the lessons can certainly help you remember all the concept easier but I feel like it is fine to go through it by myself.

reviews.comment_content: The most fundamental things about Chemistry. You don't really need much background for this course. There is not much calculation as well, so you might find it boring.

reviews.author: Zori
reviews.title: A considerable course for JEE science student
reviews.comment_content:
The basic knowledge about chemistry, it covers almost all the fields mentioned in the chemistry textbook from mainland secondary school, including elements, electronic reaction, chemical equation and so on. It will be easy for JEE student from the science track, but for an ordinary student without relevant background, the content is indeed challenging honestly speaking. Students do understand the fundamental knowledge of chemistry after the course.
Special attention should be paid by JEE students that the syllabus may be different from the one they learned from secondary school, so there is a risk when answering the questions in this course merely based on the knowledge one learned before.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Chan is a really passionate and patient instructor. His teaching in class is very clear with a comfortable accent. It will be also very easy to reach out to him after class if students encounter any problems.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading scheme consists of an individual project, a final exam, and several online quizzes. It is believed that there is a wide range of A grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not very high for JEE student with the relevant background as long as students arrange their time wisely for the group project. However, the workload will be pretty high for students without those backgrounds.
